consent.title: Welcome to our study
content: In this study, we are interested in studying people's uncertainty when observing and reason about other agents. You will read 15 scenarios and answer questions about the agents. The experiment should take 20 minutes in total.
You will be compensated for your time at the end of the study at 15 dollars / hour.
What should I know about a research study?
• Whether or not you take part is up to you.
• You can choose not to take part.
• You can agree to take part and later change your mind.
• Your decision will not be held against you.
• Your refusal to participate will not result in any consequences or any loss of benefits that you are otherwise entitled to receive.
• You can ask all the questions you want before you decide.
For any questions, please feel free to contact lanceying@mit.edu

content.value: In this experiment, you will watch a short video and read a description about an agent. Then you will answer questions about their beliefs or preferences. The tasks are intentionally designed to be somewhat ambiguous. For each scenario in this study, instead of multiple choice questions, we are interested in measuring how you evaluate the likelihood for the answer options.

The tasks often require some thinking and reasoning. Please spend at least 45 seconds on each scenario. Your response will significantly affect the results of our study, so please think carefully before you answer.

For each reasoning problem, you will use an interactive panel to distribute 10 points among the answer options. If you think one answer option is more likely, you can assign it a higher value. For example, if you think answer option B is the most likely, while A and C are still somewhat possible, you can answer like this.
You will first go through a trial run. Then you will proceed to the main experiment.
Now, let's try a simple test scenario. This will help you get familiar with the interface before starting the actual study.

config.question: Timmy is heading out for lunch after working remotely from home. There is a seafood market next to his place. Additionally, there is usually foodtrucks or foodstands parked near and behind his house. The food options are usually a taco stand and a pizza truck, although they dont come everyday. There is a wall behind his house that he cannot see past, therefore he does not know what food option is available behind his house. You observe Timmy’s trajectory as follows. Given what you see about Timmy’s actions, what do you think is Timmy’s favorite food place?

content.value: After completing this test question, click the 'Start Study' button to proceed to the main experiment.
